PILOCARPINE

Indications and doses

Primary angle-closure glaucoma, Some secondary glaucomas,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply up to 4 times a day.

Xerostomia following irradiation for head and neck cancer,

By mouth

  • For adults
    5 mg 3 times a day for 4 weeks, then increased if tolerated to up to 30 mg daily in divided doses if required, dose to be taken with or immediately after meals (last dose always with evening meal), maximum therapeutic effect normally within 4–8 weeks; discontinue if no improvement after 2–3 months.

Dry mouth and dry eyes in Sjögren’s syndrome,

By mouth

  • For adults
    5 mg 4 times a day; increased if tolerated to up to 30 mg daily in divided doses if required, dose to be taken with meals and at bedtime, discontinue if no improvement after 2–3 months.

Drug action

When used by eye

Pilocarpine acts by opening the inefficient drainage channels in the trabecular meshwork.

Advice when patient is pregnant

When used by eye

Avoid unless the potential benefit outweighs risk—limited information available.

With oral use

Avoid—smooth muscle stimulant; toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

With oral use

Reduce initial oral dose in moderate or severe cirrhosis.

Advice regarding renal impairment

With oral use

Manufacturer advises caution with tablets.

Contra indications

Known side effects

Specific side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: influenza-like symptoms, abdominal pain, asthenia, conjunctivitis, constipation, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspepsia, flushing, headache, hypertension, increased urinary frequency, lacrimation, nausea, ocular pain, palpitation, pruritus, rash, rhinitis, sweating, visual disturbances, vomiting,

uncommon: flatulence, urinary urgency,

rare: parasympathomimetics systemic side effects,

notKnown: blurred vision, ciliary spasm (leads to headache and browache which may be more severe in the initial 2–4 weeks of treatment—a particular disadvantage in patients under 40 years of age), conjunctival vascular congestion, lens changes (with chronic use), myopia, ocular burning, ocular itching, pupillary block, smarting, vitreous haemorrhage,

Advice for patients and carers

Cautions regarding administration

  • When used by eye: a darkly pigmented iris may require a higher concentration of the miotic or more frequent administration and care should be taken to avoid overdosage
  • When used by eye: asthma
  • When used by eye: cardiac disease
  • When used by eye: care in conjunctival damage
  • When used by eye: care in corneal damage
  • When used by eye: epilepsy
  • When used by eye: gastro-intestinal spasm
  • When used by eye: hypertension
  • When used by eye: hyperthyroidism
  • When used by eye: hypotension
  • When used by eye: marked vasomotor instability
  • When used by eye: Parkinson’s disease
  • When used by eye: peptic ulceration
  • When used by eye: retinal detachment has occurred in susceptible individuals and those with retinal disease
  • When used by eye: urinary-tract obstruction
  • With oral use: asthma (avoid if uncontrolled)
  • With oral use: biliary-tract disease
  • With oral use: cardiovascular disease (avoid if uncontrolled)
  • With oral use: cholelithiasis
  • With oral use: chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (avoid if uncontrolled)
  • With oral use: cognitive disturbances
  • With oral use: maintain adequate fluid intake to avoid dehydration associated with excessive sweating
  • With oral use: peptic ulceration
  • With oral use: psychiatric disturbances
  • With oral use: risk of increased renal colic
  • With oral use: risk of increased urethral smooth muscle tone
  • With oral use: susceptibility to angle-closure glaucoma

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

When used by eye

Intra-ocular pressure and visual fields should be monitored in those with chronic simple glaucoma and those receiving long-term treatment with a miotic.

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When used by eye

Although multi-dose pilocarpine eye drops commonly contain preservatives preservative-free unit dose vials may be available.

Pre-treatment screening

When used by eye

Fundus examination is advised before starting treatment with a miotic (retinal detachment has occurred).

Prepared medicinal forms of PILOCARPINE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Forms available from special-order manufacturers include: oral solution, eye drops,
Tablet
Eye drops
